data.title: Lebanon Reporter
data.meta_description: Carlos Thompson passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the Lebanon Reporter on 2010-03-03.
data.text:
New Ross

Carlos Thompson, of New Ross, met Jesus on his 86th birthday.

Mr. Thompson was born March 1, 1924, in Summerset, Ky., son of the late Joda Thompson and Bertha (Dalton) Thompson.

He married Myrtle Frederick on Aug. 18, 1946. She preceded him in death in 2000. He married Anna C. Strube on June 15, 2002. She survives.

Mr. Thompson was a member of New Bethel Fellowship. In earlier years he attended North Salem Church of God.

He served in the Army, where he was a baker for 17 officers and General MacArthur.

Mr. Thompson was a wonderful musician and loved fishing and hunting. He retired from Carrier in 1988.

Surviving are daughters, Brenda (Rick) Butler, Glenda (Hubert) Smith, Sandy (Gary) Trent and Jeannie (Mike) Carpenter; sons, Ivan (Doris) Thompson, Carl (Andrea) Thompson, Troy (Connie) Thompson and Alan (Corina) Thompson; stepdaughters, Linda (Bill) Reynolds, Tammie (Todd) Maretto, Terri (Scot) Bushong; stepson, Mike (Beth) Strube; 23 grandchildren; 11 stepgrandchildren; 21 great-grandchildren; 10 step-great grandchildren; sister, Hazel (Lowell) Rogers; brother, Ellis Thompson; and half sisters, Ina, Jane and Wanda.

He was preceded in death by four sisters, two brothers, three stepbrothers and two stepsisters.

Friends will be received from 1 to 8 p.m. Thursday, March 4, at the Porter Funeral Home, 315 W. Main St., Jamestown. Services will be held at 2 p.m. Friday, March 5, at the funeral home, with David and Brenda Deckard and Duane Bryant officiating. Interment will follow in the Pisgah Cemetery, Crawfordsville.

Online condolences may be made at www.robertporterfuneralhome.com.

Published on March 3, 2010

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentineâ€™s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
